Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Nomogram Model for Predicting Postoperative Delirium in Esophageal Cancer Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to a training set (n=278) and a testing set (n=118).

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 396 patients undergoing esophagectomy for esophageal cancer.

Intervention.evidence: The nomogram included six predictors: postoperative pain, infections, dexmedetomidine use, propofol use, mechanical ventilation duration, and PNI.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to develop a nomogram model to predict POD risk.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of POD within 14 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to a training set (n=278) and a testing set (n=118).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to a training set (n=278) and a testing set (n=118).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The model demonstrated good discrimination with an AUC of 0.919 in the training set and 0.871 in the testing set.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the intervention were reported.
